author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 16
text:
Number of the day 
1,000 
That’s about how many bees it took to delay an American Airlines flight Wednesday at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport. CNBC reported that a queen bee flew into the plane’s wing as it was getting ready to take off, and about 1,000 bees followed. Workers in protective suits eventually removed them.
Hear here 
“She worked every day on that movie and got paid nothing. It’s really horrible actually, it’s almost embarrassing.” 
Actor Bradley Cooper , talking to Reuters about how poorly co-star Amy Adams was paid for “American Hustle,” the 2013 movie they co-starred in with Jennifer Lawrence . In praising an essay that Lawrence wrote about Hollywood’s gender pay gap , Cooper said he is teaming up with female co-stars to negotiate salaries, hoping to ensure that they get paid fairly. Now, if only he could work in Silicon Valley ...
Doing it right 
Most Apple employees, including Apple Store workers, are about to get restricted stock awards in the company. In an e-mail to employees, CEO Tim Cook said the new program would award restricted stock, or shares that typically vest over a certain period of time, not just to executives or the managers and engineers who build its products but to hourly paid workers.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
